question: Most universally accepted indicator of health status of whole population and their socioeconomic conditions among the following is:
exp: Ans. (b) IMR* Infant Mortality Rate: Is one of the most universally accepted indicators of health status not only of infants, but also of the whole population and the socio-economic conditions under which they live* IMR is a sensitive indicator of availability, utilization and effectiveness of health care, particularly perinatal care* Infant Mortality Rate:- Infant Mortality Rate is a rate- Is the second-best indicator of socio-economic development of a country: Ultimate solution for lowering IMR lies in socio-economic development - Is most important indicator of health status of a community, level of living and effectiveness of MCH services in general- IMR is among 'the best predictors of state failure'ALSO REMEMBER* Disability adjusted life expectancy: DALE brings more information than infant mortality rate (IMR) when comparing the overall health status of different populations. But, DALE is quite difficult to compute and to precisely understand. For countries with limited resources that require an easily calculated measure of population health, IMR may remain a suitable choice.* UNICEF considers U5. MR or CMR as 'single best indicator of socio-economic development and well-being' (even better than IMR)

question: For optimum utilization of health services in a hospital, Bed turnover interval should always be
exp: Ans. (a) Slightly positive* Bed turn over interval: Amount of time beds at hospital are unoccupied until next patients' admission following a patients' discharge- Negative values: Indicate over 100% occupancy, scarcity of beds, over-utilization of services- Positive values: Indicate vacant beds, underutilization of services due to defective admission process or poor quality medical care- Slight positive values: Indicate optimum utilization of services

question: Which of the following rates is not only an indicator of mortality but also of the living standard of a community?
exp: Ans: A (IMR) Ref: Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine, K. Park, 22nd edition, page 525. Explanation: IMR is most important indicator of health status. Latest IMR is 48/1000 live birth in 2011. Infant mortality is largest single age category mortality. Deaths at this age are due to peculiar set of diseases and conditions to which adult population is exposed or less vulnerable. It is affected quickly and directly by specific health programs and hence change rapidly compared to crude death rate.
